Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-orange pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially grey in section, containing a number of small white inclusions, the interior bears faint traces of at least ten lines of black-painted demotic text, the exterior is covered with self-slip and faint traces of a further seven lines of black-painted demotic text, with two lines of cord-marked decoration. Joins to 66279.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393847) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393847)
